item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:12, topic:547812”]Thanks for the tip. I didn’t know that.
Mind you, I’ve never sought it out before. Sometimes it’s only when someone puts a good idea right in your face that you realise it’s a good idea.[/quote]Yeah I stumbled upon it by accident and then had to look up how I did it afterwards.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:547812”]Finally a way to test responsive sites without adjusting the browser window. Seems like such an obvious tool but it has taken a while to be developed.[/quote]This was in normal Firefox since around 6? CTRL + Shift + M
I’m not insulting you; it’s a strange shortcut to guess. The icon on the menu isn’t obvious either.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Finally a way to test responsive sites without adjusting the browser window. Seems like such an obvious tool but it has taken a while to be developed.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:7, topic:547812”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=666719.msg4458072#msg4458072 date=1416059344]
I haven’t heard anything of it until I saw this thread.

I’ve been trying it for about a day now and I have to say that it’s absolutely amazing. And I’ve always used Chrome in the past, and probably still will unless I’m doing development. But still, Mozilla took it home with this one.

Thanks for letting me know that such a thing existed.
[/quote]

I think the only time you will dislike it is when the browser has updates that you don’t know about. When you minimize the browser then open it again the screen is completely white and the only option(to my knowledge) is to close the browser and reopen. When you reopen it is when it installs the updates.[/quote]
You can change update settings. I’ve not had a problem with a white screen?

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:6, topic:547812”]I haven’t heard anything of it until I saw this thread.

I’ve been trying it for about a day now and I have to say that it’s absolutely amazing. And I’ve always used Chrome in the past, and probably still will unless I’m doing development. But still, Mozilla took it home with this one.

Thanks for letting me know that such a thing existed. :|[/quote]

I think the only time you will dislike it is when the browser has updates that you don’t know about. When you minimize the browser then open it again the screen is completely white and the only option(to my knowledge) is to close the browser and reopen. When you reopen it is when it installs the updates.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I haven’t heard anything of it until I saw this thread.

I’ve been trying it for about a day now and I have to say that it’s absolutely amazing. And I’ve always used Chrome in the past, and probably still will unless I’m doing development. But still, Mozilla took it home with this one.

Thanks for letting me know that such a thing existed.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

So far I enjoy it, It’s helped me figure out design problems I’ve been having and I’ve only used it for roughly 15 minutes now.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?

item.title: Anyone else seen the FireFox 'Developer Edition' browser?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Pwnd:

Quite interesting, however, I’m still one of those “by hand” mufudgeas.

Even so, this is still a good browser as a whole! It’s much better then the current Firefox browser. I’m using it as my main browser right now. Runs PERFECTLY!

For those Chrome users, this is actually better and is easy to transition to

Read full topic
